result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle William Santiago

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle William Santiago in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk tried to call Attorney Walter, Attorney may not have had notice of todays hearing. Set all files over to date already set. Minutes filed.
Notice of Bail Bond Forfeiture Hearing. Bond set 5-20-2022

Called at 2:09 PM. Defendant Kyle W Santiago in court, in custody by video. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for bond purposes. Discussion as to bond. State asks that prior bond forfeited with new bond remaining. Response by Attorney Hagerman. Prior bond forfeited. Bond set on 22GF1069 to cover all cases. Same prior conditions from both bonds. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

*AMENDED 10/18/2022: BOND TO COVER ALL CASES 22GF1069, 22CF283, 22CM194, 22CM229. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.L.C. dob 11-15-1967 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings*

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2500 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4802

Defendant Kyle William Santiago in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Kyle William Santiago.  Attorney JJ Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant just received the offer form the State. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved.

Defendant Kyle William Santiago in court.  Attorney Andrew Walter in court for Kyle William Santiago.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Information filed. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kyle William Santiago in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane appeared. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

BOND TO COVER 22GF502, 22CM194 & 22CM229

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.L.C. dob 11-15-1967 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-2251 thru 22-2259
